title: Vince McMahon will almost always set aside a grudge if he thinks he can make money, but what are the exceptions, or at the very least, wrestlers he has signed while holding his nose because of past perceived transgressions? - Quora

response.answer_text: At the very least, we have The Ultimate Warrior and arguably Jeff Jarrett.   Not gonna say much on them, they held Vince up for money and Vince hated it. They did come back but in very minor and no in-ring moments (though Jarrett would have a feud with Elias since he and WWE got together after WWE offered Jeff rehab). The middle of the pact we have someone who eventually did come back but not when negotiations started:  Kurt opened negotiations in 2014 and they were turned down outright (not even a single talk happened between him and Vince) and then in 2015, things went like this for him. And I quote: “Paul [Levesque] is in charge. I found that out when I contacted Vince. I’ve always had a good relationship with Paul, so I didn’t consider that a problem. But he decided they had enough talent. For the Vince McMahon who I knew, enough was never enough. He always wanted more. I don’t know what was going on over there, but they even canceled our meeting. I never went to see them. They didn’t even sit me down and talk to me.” Source: 5 Times Vince McMahon refused to rehire WWE Superstars We also have in the middle a guy WWE couldn’t want to retouch with a barge pole considering his accusations and now criminal activity:  Alberto Der Rio was indicted by a grand jury this year for aggravated kidnapping in Texas. Rio was also accused of the crime after being arrested for sexual assault and aggravated kidnapping in May. Also, considering how he treated Paige according to rumours and the fact that it got him fired from Impact (and Impact had loose standards at the best of times)… yea, Rio is someone we won’t be seeing in a WWE ring. We just won’t. It’s not gonna happen. Ironically, negotiations came close apparently… god I’m glad they didn’t. But if you want someone who he refused to sign regardless of the payday they’d give him:  “But Daniel, he’s under WWE Contract.” No, he isn’t. He’s employed by Fox. He was contracted by them directly and he has nothing to do with Vince McMahon whatsoever because Fox own the rights to air Smackdown on Television. Vince has outright said he won’t do business with Punk. After all, Punk is kinda just considered radioactive garbage by the McMahons in that they don’t wanna touch him. Not to mention Punk does still jab at the company and insult them over Twitter. Never expect him back in the ring, I think he’d prefer to be with Fox any day of the week. Hope this helped.
